author: jochembrouwer
content: Hey cool! I see there are AUTH* tests now too? üòÑ

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Heya, I have a question about this test:

`tests/prague/eip3074_auth_authcall/test_auth.py::test_extcodesize[fork_Prague-blockchain_test]`

We fail this test. It looks like we do everything right except we set the slot of storage key 1 to 0, instead of `1` as should be in the test. This is the result of `ISZERO` after `AUTH` (so the test expects that `AUTH` somehow does not setup the stack for the right `AUTH`). However, as far as I can see it all looks correct to me ü§î Any pointers?

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Is it from this PR / test? https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/e3d8541625ec0c6a8d3a4a167d089761a91e8715/tests/prague/eip3074_auth_authcall/test_auth.py#L382

The poststate there looks the same as what we report? Is the blockchain test filler which filled this test perhaps wrong?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Nvm

author: jochembrouwer
content: Got it

author: jochembrouwer
content: We don't have the extcodesize check

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: <@892053833121923094> Do you have tests for touching the blockhash contract after the blockhash opcode was called?

author: marioevz
content: That's how they currently work right now, the tx on the last block does BLOCKHASH then CALL to the contract and compares, might be worth it to add the other way around?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: yes

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Wait, just saw this PR on EIP 2935: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8564

From current EIP (so not above PR):

> Since now BLOCKHASH is served from state, the clients now additionally charge the corresponding warm or cold SLOAD costs. For verkle based networks this would imply doing and bundling corresponding accesses (and gas charges) of SLOAD.

We have never done this at all üòÆ How come we passed the tests before?
